channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Forget the four-day workweek: CEO of the world’s largest workspace provider says it’s not coming, despite what Bill Gates and Elon Musk predict
item.description: Billionaire tech CEOs promise shorter weeks thanks to AI—but IWG’s Mark Dixon says automation won’t free time, it’ll just create more work.

item.title: A.I., Big Tech and Trump Shine Most Brightly at the Davos Spectacle
item.description: The World Economic Forum is now dominated by global technology companies whose interests shunt aside most others.

item.title: As Spain Mourns Train Crash Victims, Investigators Focus on Track
item.description: Officials on Tuesday were struggling to identify bodies from the crash near the southern city of Córdoba, which killed at least 41 people.

item.title: Jerome Powell to attend Supreme Court oral argument on Lisa Cook’s attempted firing from Federal Reserve
item.description: If Trump succeeds in removing Cook, he could appoint another person to fill her slot, which would give his appointees a majority on the Fed's board.

item.title: EU chief von der Leyen on Trump: ‘A deal is a deal. And when friends shake hands, it must mean something’
item.description: "We consider the people of the United States not just our allies, but our friends," the European Commission chief said at the World Economic Forum.

item.title: Trump Heckles Europe Before Heading to Davos
item.description: As European leaders try to engage with the American president over Greenland and the future of Ukraine, he is mocking them as weak.

item.title: Bessent Calls Powell’s Attendance at Supreme Court Arguments on Fed Independence a ‘Mistake’
item.description: The Treasury secretary’s criticism comes after he attended arguments over President Trump’s tariff authority last year.

item.title: Now Boarding the Freedom Plane: Precious Founding-Era Documents
item.description: The plane, organized by the National Archives, will take rare 18th-century documents around the country in a tour loosely inspired by the Bicentennial...

item.title: Why Jollibee is turning to a U.S. IPO to fuel global growth
item.description: Global CFO Richard Shin discusses separating Jollibee Foods Corporation's international unit and listing it in the U.S.

item.title: Wall Street is once again banking on the TACO trade because they’ve been ‘burned’ by believing Trump before
item.description: At the time of writing, only 17% of Polymarket betters believe all the tariffs Trump has threatened against Europe will go into effect on February 1. ...

item.title: Islamic State Claims Deadly Attack on Chinese Restaurant in Afghanistan
item.description: A bombing that killed seven people and injured a dozen more at a noodle restaurant in a busy area of Kabul is likely to heighten China’s growing secur...

item.title: Trump Heckles Europe Before Heading to Davos
item.description: As European leaders try to engage with the American president over Greenland and the future of Ukraine, he is mocking them as weak.

item.title: ‘Chaos’ as Kurdish-Led Forces Stop Guarding Camp for ISIS Families
item.description: The Syrian Democratic Forces withdrew abruptly from the sprawling Al Hol camp, according to Syrian and Kurdish officials, during a conflict with the g...

item.title: How the Train Crash in Spain Unfolded
item.description: Two trains collided on Sunday in southern Spain, killing at least 40 people. Here is what happened.

item.title: A.I., Big Tech and Trump Shine Most Brightly at the Davos Spectacle
item.description: The World Economic Forum is now dominated by global technology companies whose interests shunt aside most others.
